resource.chars:
womanly beauty we see the so called classic re 
gular but rough features of the face, the small 
forehead, the more developed low part of body,
the wide pelvis and the strong legs. In the 
ideal of the beauty of our civilisation we 
see not these inequalities. The upper part 
of the body is more developed, the head is lar 
ger, the forehead is higher. It is true that 
this type represents the sensual beauty com
plicated by the type of clever spiritual beauty 
- but the former is lost in this compli 
cation.
As for the rest this phenomenon probably 
is the result of the other law which appear 
also in lowest animal life and was called 
by Etienne Geoffroy St Hilaire by a <u>”law of 
balancement organic”<\u>
London 79
